ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Content_item is a reference to any item that can be referenced as part of the message content. As well as externally defined items such as drawings, photographs, and so on, a message can refer to any entity represented in the schema it is used in, from products to property values, or actions to task steps.The mechanism used gives no interpretation of how the Content_item.item_identifier is interpreted or how the data is accessed. For example, the identifier could be the number of the entity in a Part 21 file. Interpretation of this entity and its attributes may be defined through reference data.

the access comment informs the user about how to access the data. This may include or imply a description what associated entities are accessed as part of the message. For example, reference to a entity may also bring with it any that applies to it.

item_type provides a reference mechanism to any entity or object referenced in the message. The item_identifier should provide a unique reference to the item referred to in the , however there is no useful way of specifying this.

titem_type provides the type of the item. The format and value will be given through reference data. A in a part 21 file may be given the type 'part 21 entity'. A log file from built in equipment may be given the type 'equipment log file'.

A Message is a collection of information, brought together by an originator (the message definer) for some particular purpose, generally the fulfillment of a process. A Message is an historical record, intended to be sent using an and in consequence, is not versioned. The same Message can be sent several times using different Envelopes. Once it has been sent once, it cannot be further changed. However it should not remain unsent, since that is to confuse its functions and therefore its meaning with other entities such as one of the types of document.
the identifier of the message. The identifier should be unique, however, given the scope of message, there is no meaningful way of specifying that uniqueness within the standard.
an optional, extended description of the purpose of the message. On the e-mail analogy, purpose is equivalent of the text of the message
contains links the Message to its contents.
defined_by identifies who ( or ) or what defined the message, that is, identified its purpose and contents.

A Message_relationship is a link between two related messages. The meaning of the association depends on Message_relationship.role. If Message.id=2 replaces Message.id=1, then Message_relationship.related points to Message.id=2 and Message_relationship.relating points to Message.id=1 with Message_relationship.role="replaces".
